meanings.sent1: The frigged car could not be repaired.
meanings.sent2: The frigged book was missing pages.
meanings.sent3: The frigged phone screen cracked after a small fall.
meanings.sent4: Her frigged dreams of a perfect vacation were shattered by bad weather.
meanings.sent5: The frigged vase lay in pieces on the floor, beyond repair.

meanings.definition: Used as an intensifier or expletive
meanings.sent1: She was frigged tired after a long day at work.
meanings.sent3: The frigged loud music made it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent4: The frigged storm outside was causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The frigged hot sun beat down relentlessly on the hikers.

meanings.sent1: They frigged in the dark corner of the room.
meanings.sent2: The couple frigged passionately under the stars.
meanings.sent3: The awkward teenagers frigged behind the school gym.
meanings.sent4: The scandalous novel described characters frigging in secret.
meanings.sent5: The forbidden lovers frigged in the moonlight, lost in each other's embrace.
